The code defines a custom setup configuration for a Python package using `setuptools`. It specifies dependencies for different backends (Dask, Ray, MPI) and additional optional features (consortium standard, spreadsheet). It integrates `versioneer` for version management and adds a custom build command (`AddPthFileBuild`) to include an extra `.pth` file (`modin-autoimport-pandas.pth`) in the package distribution. The `extra_files` list ensures this `.pth` file is packaged and installed alongside the library. The `cmdclass` dictionary maps custom commands to the setup process, ensuring the `.pth` file is added during both source distribution (`sdist`) and build (`build_py`). This setup facilitates automatic import of pandas when the package is installed.

The code defines a custom setup configuration for a Python package using `setuptools`. It specifies:

- Dependencies for different backends: Dask (`dask>=2.22.0`, `distributed>=2.22.0`), Ray (`ray>=2.1.0,!=2.5.0`, `pyarrow>=10.0.1`), and MPI (`unidist[mpi]>=0.2.1`).
- Optional features: consortium standard (`dataframe-api-compat>=0.2.7`) and spreadsheet support (`modin-spreadsheet>=0.1.0`).
- A combined list of all dependencies (`all_deps`) for convenience.

The setup integrates `versioneer` for version management and defines custom build commands (`AddPthFileBuild` and `AddPthFileSDist`) to include an extra `.pth` file (`modin-autoimport-pandas.pth`) in the package distribution. This `.pth` file ensures automatic import of pandas when the package is installed. The `cmdclass` dictionary maps these custom commands to the setup process, ensuring the `.pth` file is added during both source distribution (`sdist`) and build (`build_py`).
